intro: Sphaeralcea fasciculata var. jonesii, commonly known as the Jones' globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. This variety is characterized by its spherical, yellow-orange flower heads that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought tolerance.
